Detailed Description

Utility class for fringe analysis.

Used by fringefinder and defringe2

Member Function Documentation

void FringeUtils::ClearImage ( Image & Img,
const double NSigma ) [static]
 

Clear an image.

Set pixels values to 0 if fabs(value-mean)>NSigma*rms

void FringeUtils::Normalize ( Image & img,
const float nsigma_cut = 3 ) [static]
 

Normalize an image -> (mean=0, rms=1).

Only considers pixels for fabs(value-mean)>nsigma_cut*rms (default nsigma_cut=3)

int FringeUtils::RemoveFringes ( FitsImage & image,
const string & fringefilename,
int nvec = 0,
float nsig = 3,
bool substractbg = false,
bool verbose = true ) [static]
 

Remove fringes in an image.

Returns:
0 is everything is ok
Parameters:
image   must be in RW mode
fringemapname   name of the FITS file containing fringe patterns (one or several)
nvec   max number of vectors to use (default=0 means all of them)
nsig   cut on the image for the ScalarProduct (default=3), this cut is set to 5 for the fringes
substractbg   if true, substract background using imageback before removing fringes (and put it back afterwards) (default is false)
verbose   if true prints a lot of stuff (default is true)

double FringeUtils::ScalarProduct ( Image & Img1,
Image & Img2,
float nsigma ) [static]
 

Computes Scalar Product.

Returns:
1/p*sum(Img1(i)*Img2(i)) for( Img1(i)>nsigma*sigma1i && Img2(i)>nsigma*sigma2i ) if nsigma<0 (default), no cut is applied

double* FringeUtils::ScalarProductMatrix ( vector< string > & filelist ) [static]
 

ScalarProductMatrix is a symmetric matrix n*n computed with n images in a FitsFileSet.

Each element is the ScalarProduct(Image_i,Image_j)

Parameters:
FitsFileSet   set of images
Returns:
double array[n*n] containing the matrix

void FringeUtils::SmoothFilter ( Image & Img ) [static]
 

Smooth an image.

Convolution of Image Img with a smoothing filter 3x3 0.025, 0.100, 0.025 0.100, 0.500, 0.100 0.025, 0.100, 0.025
